core_definition.goal: Close deals faster with better preparation
core_definition.pain: Forgets details, manual CRM logging, missed follow-ups, no visibility into what AI did
core_definition.success: Prepared for every call, CRM always current, 100% confidence in automation

typical_pain_points: Zero visibility into what AI agent did and why
Can't find out why things were updated in CRM
Testing workflow changes is a nightmare (10PM-3AM sessions)
Configuration takes 100+ hours to get right
Spends 30+ min/day on manual CRM logging
CRM data is always out of date
Can't find past conversation context quickly
typical_fears: AI will log wrong info, embarrass me with manager
Will break my workflow that currently works
Learning curve will slow me down short-term
AI summary will miss the nuance I caught
Something will update incorrectly and I won't know why
typical_voice_quotes: There is zero confidence that an admin or rep can find out why things were updated the way they were in the CRM
Not seeing what happened is one of the bigger pains today
If I do get something built, testing is a nightmare. I have to build it, then trigger stuff en masse, which isn't great for my CRM hygiene
I'm probably like a hundred hours now of chatting with AskElephant to find out why something would or would not work every single time
My outcome is that I know 100% confidently that every field I want updated in HubSpot is updated after every call
I don't have time to learn another tool
If it breaks once, I'm going back to my spreadsheet
My manager just wants to see numbers in the CRM

behavioral_patterns.first_click_tendency: Looks for the biggest, most obvious button
behavioral_patterns.error_response: Blames tool, asks colleague, then gives up or reverts to manual
behavioral_patterns.help_seeking: Asks a peer before reading any documentation
behavioral_patterns.abandonment_trigger: Second failure OR first time it makes them look bad to manager
behavioral_patterns.trust_building: Needs to see exactly what AI did and why before trusting it

trust_requirements.visibility: Must be able to see what happened and why at any time
trust_requirements.auditability: Needs audit history like any good workflow program
trust_requirements.recoverability: Must be able to fix anything that's broken quickly
trust_requirements.quote: Any good workflow program on Earth has an audit history of what enrolled in the workflow. Why? What did it change?

real_customer_examples.name: James Hinkson
real_customer_examples.key_trait: 100 hours invested, deeply understands configuration pain
real_customer_examples.quote: My goal is that this should take five minutes per node
